citation.article-title: Actinocorallia gen. nov., a new genus of the order Actinomycetales.

p.s: Description of Actinocorallia herbida sp. nov.
Actinocorallia herbida (her'bi.da. L. adj. herbidus, grassy, referring to the formation of aerial mycelia like grass)
The substrate mycelium is ivory to pale yellowish brown; the aerial mycelium is white to pale yellow.
Milk is not coagulated or peptonized.
Utilizes D-glucose, D-fructose, sucrose, and L-rhamnose but not L-arabinose, D-xylose, inositol, raffinose, or D-mannitol.
Growth occurs in the presence of 3% NaCl but not in the presence of 5% NaCl.
Resistant to lysozyme and cefsulodin but not to gentamicin, novobiocin, rifampin, streptomycin, or vancomycin.
The temperature range for growth is 12 to 38°C, and the optimum growth temperature range is 24 to 32°C.
The G+C content of the DNA is 73 mol%.
The type strain is strain IFO 15485 (= AL-50780).
